justification: The reduction of GHG emissions can lead to increased food production and reduced losses, making food more affordable and accessible.
The implementation of GHG reduction targets may require significant changes in agricultural practices, potentially constraining the competitiveness of the agricultural sector.
Improving the energy efficiency of buildings can reinforce the quality of food storage and handling, leading to healthier food options.
The removal of GHG from the atmosphere can enable the reduction of pesticides by promoting more sustainable agricultural practices.
The reduction of GHG emissions can create new job opportunities in the renewable energy sector, enabling better social security and worker protection.
The transition to low-carbon transportation may increase food transportation costs, constraining food affordability.
Improving climate resilience can reinforce food quality by reducing the impacts of climate-related hazards on food production and storage.
The reduction of GHG emissions can enable better animal welfare by promoting more sustainable agricultural practices and reducing the environmental impacts of animal farming.
